avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is considerable above the tree line (level 3), below it is low. Fresh snowdrift accumulations, mainly in the north, east and south sectors, can be triggered as medium slab avalanches in many places behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls, even with a small additional load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant avalanche danger above the tree line. Even a single person can trigger a slab avalanche!

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 40 cm of new fallen snow has fallen since Thursday, sometimes interspersed with graupel. It will continue to snow until Sunday morning. The snow has been transported to the eastern sectors by strong westerly to north-westerly winds and is forming bonded snow there. The fresh wind slab can contain weak layers and often lies on an unstable layer of faceted crystals or surface hoar. In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability.

tendency.highlights: Monday will be significantly warmer during the course of the day, with the possibility of a little precipitation towards the evening. The avalanche risk will hardly change for the time being.

weatherForecast.comment:
In the night to Sunday it will snow on the northern edge of the Alps and in the Niedere Tauern with strong north-westerly winds and icy temperatures. Up to 15 cm of new fallen snow is possible, especially in the Totes Gebirge, while significantly less is expected towards the south and east.
During the day, low-lying residual clouds will continue to hang over the northern side of the Alps until midday, causing visibility problems. With a stormy north-westerly wind, it will be very cold at high altitudes. At 2000 metres, the temperature will be between -16 and -14 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is moderate above the tree line (level 2) and low below. Fresh snowdrift accumulations, mainly in the north, east and south sectors, can be triggered as medium slab avalanches in some places behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls even with a small additional load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Moderate avalanche danger above the tree line. Even a single person can trigger a slab avalanche!

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 30 cm of new fallen snow has fallen since Thursday, partly interspersed with graupel.  The snow has been transported to the eastern sectors by brisk westerly to north-westerly winds and is forming bonded snow there. In regions and terrain with little wind, the new fallen snow remains soft and powdery. The fresh wind slab often lies on an unstable layer of faceted crystals or surface hoar. In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability.

tendency.highlights: Monday will be significantly warmer during the course of the day, with the possibility of a little precipitation towards the evening. The avalanche risk will hardly change.

weatherForecast.comment:
It will snow on the northern edge of the Alps and in the Niedere Tauern in the night to Sunday with strong north-westerly winds and icy temperatures. However, only a few centimetres of fresh snow are expected.
During the day, it will be quite sunny on the southern side of the Alps from the start, but low-lying residual clouds will hang over the northern and eastern side of the Alps until midday, causing visibility problems. With a stormy north-westerly wind, it will be very cold at high altitudes. At 2000 metres, the temperature will be between -16 and -13 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. However, fresh snowdrift accumulations in gullies and bowls and behind ridges and ridgelines above the tree line are prone to disruption and can be triggered by individuals as small slab avalanches.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, but watch out for fresh wind slab!

snowpackStructure.comment: Fresh snowdrift accumulations often lie on faceted crystals or surface hoar, which can act as a weak layer. Apart from this, the old snow surface is only covered by a few centimetres of new fallen snow. In general, kinetic metamorphism weakens the thin snow base, fundament. Windward terrain is usually blown off and almost snow-free.

tendency.highlights: Monday will be significantly warmer during the course of the day, with the possibility of a little precipitation towards the evening. The avalanche risk remains low.

weatherForecast.comment:
In the night to Sunday it will snow a little on the eastern edge of the Alps with strong north-westerly winds, but only a few centimetres of fresh snow are expected.   
During the day, partly low-lying residual clouds will cloud visibility on the eastern edge of the Alps until the afternoon, while the sun will increasingly shine through in the south from the morning onwards. With a stormy north-westerly wind, it will be very cold at high altitudes. At 2000 metres, the temperature will be between -15 and -13 degrees.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Beware of fresh wind slab above the tree line! Considerable avalanche danger in places!
